alert.note: Alert for Moffat (Colorado) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.senderName: NWS GrandJunction (Western Colorado and Eastern Utah)
info.headline: Severe Thunderstorm Warning issued June 30 at 1:47PM MDT until June 30 at 2:15PM MDT by NWS GrandJunction
info.description: The National Weather Service in Grand Junction has issued a * Severe Thunderstorm Warning for... Western Moffat County in northwestern Colorado... Northern Uintah County in northeastern Utah... Northeastern Daggett County in northeastern Utah... * Until 215 PM MDT. * At 146 PM MDT, a severe thunderstorm was located 20 miles southeast of Squaw Hollow Boat Ramp On Flaming Gorge, or 23 miles east of Manila, moving east at 30 mph. HAZARD...60 mph wind gusts and penny size hail. SOURCE...Radar indicated. IMPACT...Expect damage to roofs, siding, and trees. * This severe thunderstorm will remain over mainly rural areas of western Moffat, northern Uintah and northeastern Daggett Counties. This includes the following highways... U.S. Highway 191 in Utah between mile markers 389 and 404. Colorado 318 near mile marker 1. HAIL THREAT...RADAR INDICATED MAX HAIL SIZE...0.75 IN WIND THREAT...RADAR INDICATED MAX WIND GUST...60 MPH
info.instruction: For your protection move to an interior room on the lowest floor of a building. Large hail and damaging winds and continuous cloud to ground lightning is occurring with this storm. Move indoors immediately. Lightning is one of nature`s leading killers. Remember, if you can hear thunder, you are close enough to be struck by lightning.
